author: andreas
content:
Earl, I really don't like fiddling in HDR applications. I use one of their presets, export as TIFF and do everything else in Photoshop. My results from the HDR programs are normally much in need of contrast and some saturation. I really use the HDR mappers to contain the dynamic range.

As to buying it again: yes. I am really, really satisfied with this lens. I suppose for a Canon user it would be tempting to spend more for the stabilized Canon version (maybe), but for Nikon you really have no choice. I could imagine (well, I really can) buying the Nikon 16-85 as well, and to use that as the "sunny weather travel zoom", but what I needed and wanted now, was something for the long night that is winter ðŸ™‚
